questions.neutral: Did you walk the long way?

hobby.message: Is analog photography still worth the risk?
Still dodging towers with those drones?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah, took a detour.
Needed some air after work.
I fly drones for a hobby, sometimes after shift.
Wasn’t a smooth flight—city’s been strange since Halden.
Yeah, I did—avoided the main checkpoints.
I fly drones for stress relief, mostly industrial zones.
Signal interference was worse than usual today.
Probably linked to recent system glitches.
Didn’t stay out long.
Took the long way, yeah. Needed to clear my head.
I do freestyle FPV drone flying—night sessions by the old railyard.
Usually it helps me reset, focus.
Whole city’s tech was acting up after Halden’s death.
Couldn’t get stable signal—lots of drone fails last night.
Makes you rethink the risks lately.
Yeah, I like walking before I fly—helps me get in the zone.
My hobby’s FPV drone flying, the freestyle kind, industrial areas mostly.
Was out by Sector F-11 last night after shift.
City was off—GPS and BCI overlays kept freezing after the Halden news.
A few pilots lost signal entirely. Airspace did weird things.
Makes me careful about logging flights now.
Suppose that’s the new normal here.
Yep, I took the industrial loop—easier to stay off the main grid.
I’ve been flying FPV drones since uni—freestyle, high-speed stuff, off-grid zones.
Flying helps me feel present—in control for once.
Last night was messy; BCI failures after Halden died had airspace jittery, GPS unreliable.
Never seen so many quads drop link or get stuck in fencing loops.
Everyone in our underground group noticed system lag in their wearables too.
I usually scrub my logs, but wiped them twice this time—paranoia’s standard now.
Feels like the whole city is waiting for something else to go wrong.
hobby_answer: Yeah, mostly clean. Harder to predict lately, though.
Airspace isn’t stable—too many random outages after the Directorate update.
Didn’t risk the usual spots last week, BCI lag spikes everywhere.
Saw some people get stuck on fallback networks, not ideal.
Prefer waiting until things normalize again.
FPV's still running, but you notice the system struggling since Halden.
Last time out, band interference nearly grounded my quad for good.
Uploads kept timing out—probably more system bugs than protocols.
People got jumpy when the BCI sync froze; no one wants to be flagged now.
Feels like half the usual pilots stayed home this week.
Not the best atmosphere lately.
Routes are open, but nothing’s predictable after Halden died.
My footage glitched from GPS loss—city's feeds are unstable.
I saw at least three regulars lose drone link at F-11 last weekend.
BCI overlays were non-responsive, delayed uploads for everyone.
None of us wanted to linger; weird being that exposed now.
Feels like the system’s holding its breath, honestly.
Takes the fun out when tech can’t keep up.
FPV's basically my therapy, but last weekend was chaos after Halden.
City threw GPS errors everywhere, even the geofences bugged out at F-11.
A friend almost lost their quad—return-to-home failed, first time I’ve seen that.
BCI overlays froze, so I scrubbed my logs just in case.
Couldn’t relax, too many sync issues and fallback spikes.
Everyone's worried about getting flagged for nothing.
Not much point flying if I’m tense the whole time.
Maybe I’ll wait until the Council gets its act together.
Yeah, I fly when I can, but after Halden, the city’s not the same.
I started FPV to get away from system noise, clear my head.
Now even our old railyard spot's glitching—drones dropping out, GPS loops, network spikes.
I know it’s because the BCI’s backend can’t sync since Halden’s codes got sealed.
BCI overlays flagged all of us as anomalous just for being there.
I nearly risked dropping out of the safe score zone—lost sleep scrubbing data.
Kind of reminds me how my brother vanished after his audit. Makes you double-check everything.
Felt like the city was watching extra hard, waiting for someone to trip up.
If it stays like this, I might have to stop for a while—wasn’t supposed to get risky.
